peopleAlsoAsk.question: What does an art appraisal cost?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Art appraisers may adjust their hourly rate depending on the scope of the appraisal assignment, but on average you should expect to pay between $150-$500 per hour for a USPAP-compliant art appraisal.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How much does it cost to get art appraised?

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I find out what my artwork is worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Appraisals & Appraisers Consider finding an appraiser to determine the value of your artwork. Appraisers are trained specialists who work for a fee. They evaluate your piece and give you a written statement of its value.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How Much Is Your Object Worth? | Smithsonian American Art Museum

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Are art appraisals worth it?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: To find out more about your artwork: An art appraisal can tell you more about your artwork, such as its history, provenance, and condition. This information can be helpful in making decisions about how to care for your artwork.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: 7 Considerations Before An Art Appraisal | The Marshall Gallery

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the best way to get art appraised?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Look for Qualified Appraisers: Seek appraisers who are certified by reputable organizations, such as the American Society of Appraisers (ASA) or the International Society of Appraisers (ISA). Check their credentials and experience in the specific type of art you have (eg, paintings, sculptures, etc.).
